Don't get locked out of your room.
Greek Life is great. Meet your bridesmaids/groomsmen and join greek life. It's not like a big school or House Bunny type greek life, it's something completely different.
There's a lot of clubs, but not a ton of people in all these clubs. Find a club or two, but don't try to stretch yourself thin.
Students who really like to challenge themselves beyond what is given to them, are self motivated, and more concerned about academics than anything else.

Queens has a lot of great traditions that you have to attend for the full experience. Casino night, Moravian Love Feast, Boar's Head, Midnight on Ice, Exam Breakfasts, Homecoming, and Spring Carnival are all something you have to do at least once.
Try to get as many scholarships as possible, Queens does come with a big price tag.
Explore Charlotte!
Good luck if you have food allergies. They don't understand cross contaminations and there's maybe something decent once a week.
Most people keep to themselves in the dorms.

Varies by professor, and you get what you put into it. Take Perkins for your science credit. Not many professors will take you hiking and teach class at the top of a mountain. Despite what people say, core is an awesome class. Really try to take stuff away from it, because it seems time consuming, but it is extremely valuable.
Be sure you are a person for a small school. When I say Queens is small, it is SMALL.
It's a interesting little school, but definitely for those who are self seeking learners. There's a lot of opportunity for personal growth. The professors are absolutely fantastic.

Teachers and students work together and between the professors and the Learning Center for Academic Success, they are determined to help the student learn.
